selection_reasoning: The selection includes the top 3 performers which represent three distinct successful strategies: custom force-directed heuristics (0_8), smoothed gradient descent (0_3), and subgradient-based local optimization (0_10). I've also included the best global search frameworks (DE and CMA-ES) to maintain evolutionary potential and diversity.

trial_selections.reasoning: Top performer (0.9961). Uses a custom force-directed heuristic with adaptive thresholds and periodic normalization. This approach effectively navigates the non-differentiable landscape of min-max ratios.
Second best (0.9797). Uses a robust multi-start L-BFGS-B strategy with a SoftMin (LogSumExp) objective. This is the most successful gradient-based approach.
Third best (0.9777). Uses SLSQP with a subgradient-summation approach. It provides a different way of handling non-smoothness compared to trial_0_3.
Hybrid global-local approach (DE + SLSQP). While it scored lower (0.9645), the framework is sound and might benefit from the 'SoftMin' or 'Force-Directed' techniques found in better trials.
Uses CMA-ES (0.9379). Represents a fundamentally different optimization philosophy (evolutionary/derivative-free) that provides diversity to the pool.
